tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE RouteData (
    route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    route_name VARCHAR(255),
    start_location VARCHAR(255),
    end_location VARCHAR(255),
    distance_km FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE CongestionData (
    congestion_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    route_id INT,
    congestion_level ENUM('low', 'medium', 'high'),
    congestion_duration_minutes INT
);

CREATE TABLE route_optimization (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    route_id INT,
    distance FLOAT,
    estimated_time INT,
    optimum_speed FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE TrafficData (
    data_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    route_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    speed FLOAT,
    congestion_level ENUM('low', 'medium', 'high')
);

CREATE TABLE CongestionAnalysis (
    analysis_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    route_id INT,
    congestion_level ENUM('low', 'medium', 'high'),
    analysis_result TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE traffic_data (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
route_name VARCHAR(255),
start_location VARCHAR(255),
end_location VARCHAR(255),
traffic_speed INT,
traffic_congestion_level INT);

CREATE TABLE traffic_cameras (camera_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
location VARCHAR(255),
traffic_data_id INT,
FOREIGN KEY (traffic_data_id) REFERENCES traffic_data(id));

CREATE TABLE traffic_incidents (incident_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
incident_type VARCHAR(255),
location VARCHAR(255),
description TEXT,
reported_on TIMESTAMP);

CREATE TABLE traffic_sensors (sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
location VARCHAR(255),
sensor_type VARCHAR(255),
status VARCHAR(50));

CREATE TABLE route_recommendations (recommendation_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
route_name VARCHAR(255),
recommended_speed INT,
estimated_time_minutes INT);
